modules.description: This module generates precomputed tables of multiples of the generator point on the P-521 elliptic curve, specifically structured for efficient scalar multiplication during digital signature operations. It returns the tables as a three-dimensional string array with fixed dimensions derived from the curve's field element size. These tables are intended to be hardcoded into the library at compile time to optimize performance of DSA operations.

This module generates a deterministic nonce `k` for digital signatures using the P-256 curve, following RFC6979. It operates on a private key and a message digest, producing a nonce suitable for signing. It is used to ensure secure and deterministic signature generation in cryptographic applications.

This module generates a deterministic nonce `k` for digital signatures using the P-521 curve and a specified hash function. It operates on private keys and message digests to produce values suitable for signing. Useful in cryptographic applications requiring deterministic signature generation, such as secure messaging or blockchain transactions.

This module generates precomputed tables of multiples of the generator point on the P-384 elliptic curve, specifically structured for efficient scalar multiplication during digital signature operations. It outputs a 3D array of strings representing field elements, with dimensions derived from the curve's field size. These tables are intended to be hardcoded into the library to accelerate cryptographic computations at compile time.

This module generates a deterministic nonce `k` for digital signatures using the P-384 curve, based on RFC6979. It takes a private key and message digest as inputs and produces a cryptographically suitable `k` value for signing. It is used to ensure secure and reproducible nonce generation when creating ECDSA signatures with the P-384 curve.

This module generates precomputed tables of multiples of the generator point on the P-256 curve, specifically structured as a 3D array of strings with dimensions `(Fe_length * 2, 15, 3)`. These tables are used to accelerate scalar multiplication operations during cryptographic computations. The output is intended to be hardcoded into the library for performance optimization during digital signature operations.

This module implements the Diffie-Hellman key exchange protocol using the NIST P-256 elliptic curve. It provides functions to generate ephemeral key pairs, encode/decode secrets, and compute shared secrets from a private key and a peer's public key. It operates on curve points represented as strings, with support for optional point compression during encoding. Use cases include secure key agreement for TLS sessions and encrypted messaging protocols requiring ephemeral key exchange.

This module implements Diffie-Hellman key exchange on the NIST P-521 elliptic curve. It operates on a `secret` type representing private keys and uses strings for public key and shared secret encodings. Functions support key generation, secret encoding/decoding, and computing shared secrets, suitable for secure key agreement in TLS or encrypted communications.

This module implements the ECDSA digital signature algorithm over the NIST P-384 elliptic curve. It provides private and public key operations including key generation, serialization, signature creation with optional deterministic nonce, and signature verification. It handles fixed-size binary data for keys and signatures, supporting direct integration with cryptographic protocols requiring binary encoding or decoding of key material and signatures.

This module implements the ECDSA digital signature algorithm using the NIST P-521 elliptic curve. It provides key generation, signature creation, and verification operations, working with private and public key types represented as strings. Concrete use cases include signing and verifying TLS certificates, blockchain transaction signatures, and secure firmware updates where high-security digital signatures are required.

This module implements the Diffie-Hellman key exchange protocol using the NIST P-384 elliptic curve. It provides functions to generate ephemeral key pairs, encode/decode secrets, and compute shared secrets from a private key and a peer's public key. It is used to securely establish shared cryptographic keys between parties over insecure channels.

This module implements the ECDSA digital signature algorithm over the NIST P-256 elliptic curve. It provides private and public key operations including key generation, serialization, signature creation, and verification. It handles fixed-size binary data for keys and signatures, supporting deterministic nonce generation per RFC 6979 and optional public key compression.

This module implements cryptographic operations over the NIST P-384 elliptic curve, providing Diffie-Hellman key exchange and ECDSA digital signature functionalities. It works with binary-encoded keys and signatures, supporting secure key agreement and message authentication in protocols like TLS and secure messaging. The Dh submodule generates key pairs and computes shared secrets, while the Dsa submodule handles signing, verification, and key serialization.

Implements cryptographic operations on the NIST P-256 elliptic curve, including Diffie-Hellman key exchange and ECDSA digital signatures. Works with curve points, private and public keys, and signatures represented as fixed-size binary data or encoded strings. Used for secure key agreement in TLS and encrypted messaging, as well as for generating and verifying digital signatures in authentication and document signing applications.

This module implements Curve 25519 Diffie-Hellman key exchange. It operates on secret keys represented as a `secret` type and public keys as strings. Functions include key generation, encoding/decoding secrets, and computing shared secrets, suitable for secure key exchange in protocols like TLS or SSH.

This module implements cryptographic operations on the NIST P-521 elliptic curve, including Diffie-Hellman key exchange and ECDSA digital signatures. It works with private and public keys, using strings for key encodings, and supports key generation, shared secret computation, signature creation, and verification. It is used for secure key agreement in TLS, blockchain transaction signing, and firmware update verification.

This module implements Ed25519 digital signature operations, including key generation, private and public key serialization, public key derivation from private keys, and functions to sign and verify messages. It works with private (`priv`) and public (`pub`) key types, handling cryptographic operations according to RFC 8032. Concrete use cases include securing communications, authenticating data, and implementing blockchain signatures.

This module implements elliptic curve cryptographic operations for Diffie-Hellman key exchange, ECDSA digital signatures, and Ed25519 signatures using standardized curves (P-256, P-384, P-521, Curve25519). It handles key generation, encoding/decoding, shared secret computation, and signature creation and verification, working with binary-encoded keys and signatures as strings or specialized types. It is used in TLS key agreement, blockchain transaction signing, firmware verification, and secure messaging protocols.
